title: Charles Schwab Down Over 8%, on Pace for Largest Percent Decrease Since June 2016 — Data Talk
text:
Charles Schwab Corporation (SCHW) is currently at $38.34, down $3.49 or 8.34%

-- Would be lowest close since Sept. 3, 2019, when it closed at $37.96

-- On pace for largest percent decrease since June 24, 2016, when it fell 11.92%

-- Earlier Tuesday, Charles Schwab Corp. said it would eliminate commissions on trades made on its mobile and web channels, rattling the online brokerage industry

-- Credit Suisse cut its price target for Charles Schwab to $49.00/share From $55.00/share, Benzinga reported

-- Snaps a two day winning streak

-- Down 7.68% year-to-date

-- Down 35.66% from its all-time closing high of $59.59 on May 22, 2018

-- Traded as low as $37.48; lowest intraday level since Sept. 3, 2019, when it hit $37.30

-- Down 10.4% at today's intraday low; largest intraday percent decrease since June 24, 2016, when it fell as much as 11.92%

-- Second worst performer in the S&P 500 today

-- Fourth most active stock in the S&P 500 today

All data as of 10:23:05 AM

Source: Dow Jones Market Data, FactSet

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 01, 2019 10:44 ET (14:44 GMT)
